results.title: My world: water
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Chevron Chemical Co and Paul Fillinger
results.brief_description: A montage of experiences related to the uses and delights of water. Explores the water cycle, importance of water to life, how water gets to our homes, the uses of water and the need for conservation. Uses songs, children’s voices and imaginative photography to highlight importance of water to us. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: My wife, my horse and myself
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A History of British art”.
The traditional 18th century style, portraits of dogs, horses and family was the province of British artists; their aristocratic clients bought their ‘real art’ in Italy. Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.

results.title: My way
results.creator_credit: La Trobe University and Patricia Edgar
results.brief_description: This film contrasts and compares the attitudes and styles of three Victorian Education Department teachers. Controversial issues are discussed openly and classroom activities provide an inside view of teaching styles.

results.title: My voyage to Italy = Il Mio Viaggio In Italia
results.creator_credit: Media Trade Cappa Productions, Barbara de Fina, Giuliana Del Punta and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: Interweaving his personal history, growing up in Italian-American culture of New York in the 1940s, Martin Scorsese presents his fascinating perspective on the cinema of Italian Neo-Realism. As a young boy, Scorsese watched innumerable of these iconic works on his parents tiny TV set, subtly influencing what would become his cinematic style. Using extensive clips from such works as “Rome, Open city”, “La Dolce vita”, “L’Aventura” and “8 and 1/2” Scorsese discusses his love and enduring admiration of these works whilst analysing the mise en scene and meanings behind the motifs. As well as being a fascinating insight into Scorseses influences, “My Voyage to Italy” inspires the viewer to re-visit the work of the Italian Neo-Realists. Directors featured include Antonioni, Di Sica, Fellini, Renoir, Rossellini, Visconti, and Blaseti.

results.title: My valley is changing
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett, John Martin-Jones, David Haythornthwaite, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Lionel Hudson
results.brief_description: Shows how the people of Bougainvillea are reacting to the changes brought about by the mining operations. They are finding it difficult to adapt but copper export means income for the whole territory and provides jobs and training for people eager for independence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roland Beckett, John Martin-Jones, David Haythornthwaite, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Lionel Hudson

results.title: My uncle = Mon oncle [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Louis Dolivet, Specta, Fray, Alterdel-Centaure and Jacques Tati
results.brief_description: Mon Oncle is a poetic satire depicting man against machine, rather in the manner of Chaplin’s “Modern Times” and Rene Clair’s “A Nous la Liberte”. Hulot is little Gerard Arpel’s uncle, a fond relative whose whimsical ways fail to impress the boy’s ultra-modern parents. What transpires is a masterpiece of design which develops Tati’s unique comic vision without ever losing sight of the essential simplicity he holds so dear. Deft, elusive, full of heart, “Mon Oncle” is a film to see again and again. Winner of Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. Also available on VHS [301867].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louis Dolivet, Specta, Fray, Alterdel-Centaure and Jacques Tati

results.title: My turtle died today
results.brief_description: In this first-person story, a boy recalls the death of a pet. His father, his teacher, and the pet-shop owner are unable to help his sick turtle, and it dies. This story creates an opportunity for discussion of the inevitability of death and the continuity of life. Adapted from the Little Owl book.

results.title: My tribe
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Judith Rigney and ACMI
results.brief_description: Judith Rigney’s family are the love of her life. At age 22, Rigney gave birth to her first child. Here she proudly and lovingly pays tribute her ‘tribe’.

results.title: My time again - Richard Burton
results.brief_description: Richard Burton talks about how he became an actor, and discusses the art of acting for stage and screen with Michael Elwyn who is, like Burton, a Welsh actor who moved towards professional acting while a member of the Oxford University Dramatic Society.
